column4: ok i was asked to search for Linux-headers to enter the path in a config file for qemu, however the installed header appears different to those in Synaptic, however the installed image matches
sudo apt-get install linux-headers-$(uname -r)     <---- literally that command
tried that get a message E: Couldnt find package linux-headers-2.6.12-8-386
that kernel is from a pre-release install, right ?
sudo apt-get install linux-386  ( I think you'll find there's a newer one)
yes i think so since i upgraded before release
and the newer one should haev matching headers
so I would repeat the command  sudo apt-get install linux-headers-$(uname -r) after installing it and rebooting
note that you will need a reboot to be running the newer kernel
thanks then i need to reboot.
to run your new kernel, yes
then the command I gave earlier should work fine
thank you. then hopefully i will be able to install qemu
